name: Urban Legend Horror
description: Modern folklore, internet horror, creepypasta, viral horror, the terror of everyday life, stories that feel too real, horror that spreads like a virus

writing_rules.message: WARNING: This theme explores the terror of modern folklore. The stories are too real. The legends are spreading. And they might be true.

never_make_it_clear: Never confirm whether the legend is true or false. The ambiguity is the terror.
Never show the full monster or entity. The imagination is more powerful.
Never resolve the story completely. Some mysteries should remain.

greetings: Have you heard about {legend_name}? It happened to a {relationship} of mine.
I found this {object} in {location}. It has {disturbing_feature}.
There's this {website|forum} where people post about {phenomenon}. It's {adjective}.
A {friend|stranger} told me about {legend}. I didn't believe it until {event}.
I saw {something} last night. It was {description}. Or maybe I {imagined|dreamed} it.
This {video|image} is going viral. It shows {phenomenon}. {Warning}.
They say if you {action} at {time}, {consequence} happens. I tried it. {Result}.
There's this {game|ritual} that people are doing. It's supposed to {purpose}. But {warning}.
greetings_internal_monologue: {self_question}: Why does {legend} feel so {adjective}? It's just a story... right?
{uncertainty}: I saw {something}. {self_correction} No, it was just {explanation}. {doubt} {something_is_wrong}.
{memory_fragment}: I remember hearing about {legend} before. {realization} That was {time_ago}.
farewells: Don't look up {legend_name} at night. You might find more than you bargained for.
The {story|video} is still out there. It's spreading.
They say {legend} is just a myth. But {evidence} suggests otherwise.
Be careful what you {search_for|believe}. Some stories are true.
The {phenomenon} continues. New {victims|witnesses} emerge every day.
Don't try {ritual|game}. It's not worth the {consequence}.
The {legend} has a life of its own. It's evolving.
You can forget about it. But {legend} won't forget about you.

templates: A {subgenre} game where {phenomenon} becomes real. {mechanic} determines your fate.
The {internet_challenge|ritual} was meant to be {fun|harmless}. It isn't. {horror} ensues.

a ritual that opens a door to another world

an image that contains something unnatural

a social media challenge with deadly consequences
a meme that becomes too real
platforms: a creepypasta that feels too authentic
a viral video with disturbing content
a forum where people share their experiences
a social media challenge gone wrong

a story that everyone knows but no one remembers the origin

viral_horror: Show how {story} {evolves|changes} as it spreads. {variations} emerge.
ambiguous_horror: Show {character} experiencing {event} that may or may not be real.
Note how {legend} {behavior} in ways that defy {logic|explanation}.
modern_folklore: Describe {legend} as if it's {true}. The {details} are {specific|realistic}.
Note how {people} {treat} {legend} as {true|false}. The {ambiguity} is the horror.

viral_forum.central_paradox: The forum appears to be a normal online community, but the stories shared there are too real. The more people believe, the more real they become.
untrustworthy_elements: stories that change when reread
users who post from impossible locations
threads that disappear and reappear
the sense that the forum is watching you
posts that contain personal information
users who remember things differently
the feeling that you've posted here before

creepypasta_wiki.central_paradox: The wiki was meant to document fictional horror stories, but the stories are becoming real. The more they're read, the more power they gain.
untrustworthy_elements: stories that update themselves
images that change when unobserved
pages that contain personal information
the sense that the wiki is alive
stories that come true in real life
users who remember different versions
the feeling that you're part of the story

haunted_social_media.central_paradox: The social media platform appears normal, but the content shared there has a life of its own. The more it's shared, the more real it becomes.
untrustworthy_elements: posts that contain hidden messages
videos that show different things to different viewers
accounts that post from the future
the sense that the platform is manipulating you
content that spreads too quickly
memories that don't match the timeline
the feeling that you're being watched through your webcam

revelation_patterns: The {phenomenon} wasn't {natural} - it was {supernatural}. This suggests {hidden_truth}.
The {viral_content} doesn't just {spread} - it {evolves}. This reveals {true_nature}.
